title: Measurement Conversions and Units

vocab.definition: Changing from one unit of measurement to another
The measurement system used in the United States (inches, feet, pounds)
The measurement system based on tens (centimeters, meters, grams)
How much liquid a container can hold
The amount of matter in an object

teachingNotes: Teach common conversions within the same system (12 inches = 1 foot, 1000 grams = 1 kilogram). Use real-world examples and hands-on measuring activities. Compare customary and metric systems.

sample.question: How many inches are in 3 feet?
How many centimeters are in 2 meters?
Which is greater: 1 kilogram or 800 grams?
How many feet are in 2 yards?
Which unit would you use to measure a paperclip's mass?
Which unit would you use to measure a swimming pool's capacity?

truefalse.question: A meter is longer than a yard.
There are 10 centimeters in a meter.
A milliliter is larger than a liter.
A kilometer is shorter than a meter.
Mass and weight are always the same thing.

multiplechoice.question: Which is the best unit to measure the length of a pencil?
How many ounces are in 3 pounds?
How many grams are in 2 kilograms?
Which is closest to the mass of a textbook?

fillintheblank.question: To convert 5 pounds to ounces, you multiply by 16 to get ________ ounces.
To convert 3 km to meters, multiply by _____.
A small paperclip has a mass of about _____ grams.
